description: Students explore poetry and prose from the earliest periods in the development of the English language and literature -- by Caedmon, the Beowulf poet, Chaucer, Julian of Norwich, Malory, Spenser, Shakespeare, Lady Mary Wroth, Donne, Milton -- and investigate how literary conventions and social history interact. From sermons to sonnets, students examine 1000 years of literary history and ultimately follow the voyage of English from Britain to the Americas. Prerequisite: Prior or simultaneous study in English 185.
name: Lit in Engl to 1650
notes: Students in English 221 must also register for one discussion section 221AD or
prerequisites: Prior or simultaneous study in English 185.

revisions.prerequisites: Prerequisite: Prior or simultaneous study in English 185.

title: Literatures in English to 1650
